data.text: How do we plan a path to recovery from the #COVID19 crisis? Join @KGeorgieva and @IgnatiusPost in a conversation about the impact of #COVID19 on the global economy, and a look forward to the recovery. June 3, 2:00pm ET @postlive https://t.co/beKBYnd5ZV https://t.co/geE6fHhf66

Challenges of today—#COVID19, #SDGs, #Climate—are all global. They need collective &exceptional action from both public institutions &private sector. Deputy Managing Director Antoinette Sayeh @ #Fin4Dev webinar by @Sida & @UNDESA #BuildBackBetter
 
Replay https://t.co/8uMAultmyN https://t.co/cY3ly0HBTd

STARTING now: IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva, HRH The Prince of Wales, and @wef Founder Prof. Klaus Schwab will engage in an inspiring & energizing conversation on how to build a #GreenRecovery after the #COVID19 crisis. #TheGreatReset

Join them ➡️ https://t.co/b84tV5GjVI

Join Antoinette Sayeh, Deputy Managing Director + global finance&development leaders for a webinar on: "The Impact of #COVID19 on Financing for Sustainable Development &the #2030Agenda"- June 3, 7:30am ET. @Sida @UNDESA #BuildBackBetter #DevTalks #Fin4Dev https://t.co/zdPq9hKsA6
LIVE NOW: A Discussion on IMF Emergency Assistance to Africa on COVID-19: Finance, Debt-Relief and Policy Reforms.  https://t.co/QlF3qa3Knh  #IMFAfrica https://t.co/jwMzW5vXCK

Today, we launched our June 2020 issue of Finance & Development magazine, which focuses on economic policymaking and politics in light of the pandemic. It’s a must-read for the summer. Click here to learn more: https://t.co/LcigiuDcpM #COVID19

IMF Executive Board completes Second Reviews Under SBA and SCF Arrangement and approves augmentations of access or US$223 to support Honduras’ COVID-19 measures. https://t.co/axz2tIcNKv https://t.co/2EzDL4MYZE
IMF Board approves US$250 million disbursement to The Bahamas to address the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/B4ychcgf1i https://t.co/Xb44wS14K4
WATCH LIVE: Tomorrow, June 1 at 12:30pm EDT – IMF Emergency Assistance to Africa on COVID-19: Finance, Debt-Relief and Policy Reforms. https://t.co/QlF3q9M8YH #IMFAfrica

Chile and Peru have joined Colombia and Mexico as recipients of the IMF’s FCL, available to countries with strong economic track records & policy frameworks. The credit line provides insurance against external shocks and sends a strong signal of support from the global community. https://t.co/ppPssi8bU3

The June 2020 issue of Finance & Development magazine explores the interplay between economic policymaking, politics and  pandemics. Read letter from the editor-in-chief on the issue  https://t.co/Uj7S2MYDAB #IMFBlog https://t.co/8gxBW2ni12

The IMF Executive Board today approved the disbursement of US$28.5 million in emergency financing to help #SolomonIslands ease the social and economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/pClebBc00Q https://t.co/AAJyA5rvKa
The $3.4 billion IMF emergency financing package for #Nigeria will support health care sector, protect jobs and businesses. https://t.co/OyA1kaA3Fc #IMFAfrica https://t.co/lbhOvJJrdp
The June 2020 issue of IMF Finance & Development magazine focuses on economic policymaking and politics in light of the global pandemic. Learn more at: https://t.co/jvvJOZuHoF https://t.co/3mN1to4HKF
IMF staff provides analysis of Argentine authorities’ revised debt restructuring proposal as part of ongoing technical assistance. See the statement: https://t.co/8DKx4sHFOL #Argentina
REPLAY: Ideas to Respond to Weaker Growth. https://t.co/xmL1yxWNk0 #COVID19 #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/vaRl0HGj0p

https://t.co/P5xm42gRyB https://t.co/NTEaEeKay3

Without a vaccine or effective treatment against #COVID19, #policymakers will be balancing the benefits of resuming economic activity against the potential cost of another increase in infection rates. They face difficult choices. https://t.co/iCGEtaJ0uJ #IMFBlog https://t.co/E6runjUb9b
How do reopening strategies compare across Asia and Europe? The IMF’s Delia Velculescu and Davide Furceri share perspectives on the issue. https://t.co/o0Ym1J5Qnc #COVID19 https://t.co/oTqF5KHXRW

.@KGeorgieva: The best memorial we can all build for those who have lost their lives to the #COVID19 pandemic is to build a more resilient and prosperous world. https://t.co/bsv9ElprnN https://t.co/7QbSI1j1EN

Read #IMFCountryFocus interview with the IMF’s resident representative in #Uganda, Clara Mira, where she describes the economic situation confronting Uganda and how the country will use the emergency loan from the IMF to fight #COVID19. https://t.co/AV0P6GsRlA

#Caribbean economies, where tourism accounts for 50-90% of GDP in some countries, are being hit hard by the sudden stop in global cruise lines and air travel. #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/o8X2I3u93K https://t.co/G97xziYqj8

Monday, June 1 at 10 am EDT https://t.co/YihqQvZwgl

Chile’s very strong policies, economic performance, and institutions have been instrumental in absorbing the impact of recent shocks. The Flexible Credit Line of US$23.93 bln will provide valuable insurance against tail risks arising from #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/JE5PcNjz0o https://t.co/PY3taqrqPZ

#Bangladesh is the 60th country to receive IMF emergency financing. Today, US$732 million was approved by the IMF’s Executive Board to help the country fight the social and economic challenges of #COVID19. https://t.co/cd3oNF09nE https://t.co/S1BrHqyb7T

Historical analysis shows only 10% of climatic disasters had significant market impact. Chapter 5 of #GFSR argues equity investors are ill-prepared to assess complex risks developing over very long timeframes. https://t.co/UGvWJ5debY #IMFBlog https://t.co/T1SoYOONMU

Global warming will increase frequency and severity of extreme weather events. Equity investors might not be pricing adequately the risk associated with loss of life and property and economic disruption. Read the #IMFBlog: https://t.co/s9x3n1LQdn #GFSR https://t.co/hWEyOOjDC3

The new #GFSR research says #ClimateChange stress tests are becoming more common, & a good way for financial firms and governments to better understand risks related to the physical damage, life loss, & economic disruption caused by severe weather events https://t.co/JIHoF6uWaX https://t.co/VycqxaU6ja
Starting Now: Live discussion on our new #GFSR research on #ClimateChange with IMF Financial Counsellor, Tobias Adrian https://t.co/Ld1HjGeixO @IIF  https://t.co/ouQvSgmeoT

The IMF’s Flexible Credit Line serves as temporary insurance to support Peru’s very strong policy and institutional frameworks against the #COVID19 shock. #Peru intends to treat the arrangement as precautionary. https://t.co/jm0anxtWeE https://t.co/IMMoaJ18DU

IMF's First Deputy Managing Director @gwsokamoto speaks with Bloomberg's @tomkeene on the IMF's role at the forefront of the COVID19 economic crisis. Watch the interview here 👉https://t.co/W31ZP4H0it https://t.co/rohKwbjk4z

In an interview with #IMFCountryFocus, Jamaica’s Finance Minister @DrNigelClarkeJa explains what measures his country is taking to protect lives and livelihoods from the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/gEMEXxhUNf https://t.co/Ck141DoqCp
Remarks by @KGeorgieva at the @UN High-Level-Event on Financing for Development in the Era of COVID-19 and Beyond. https://t.co/e0R341N1b5 #Fin4Dev #GlobalGoals https://t.co/7aBEn4jAnC

.@KGeorgieva: The #COVID19 crisis could have been even worse without the decisive policy actions taken by many countries. Globally, fiscal actions so far amount to about US$9 trillion. More is still needed. #Fin4Dev #GlobalGoals https://t.co/afY2GivfUB

Read our latest #IMFCountryFocus to find out how the Jamaican government has ramped up its recovery efforts and established a special task force to effectively respond to the economic impact of the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/R4rWT9bwo4 #Jamaica https://t.co/awvybDbZmu

The timing, sequencing, and pace of planned exits from lockdowns triggered by #COVID19 differ across countries. They reflect differences in the progress of the epidemic but also national preferences. #IMFBlog https://t.co/iCGEtaJ0uJ https://t.co/Q20UjXSHAW

Remittances—which represent 14% of GDP in fragile countries across #MENA and serve as a lifeline for many households—are also expected to tumble by 20% as global incomes fall due to COVID-19. Read more in our latest #IMFCountryFocus at  https://t.co/V3YYBqyfoP https://t.co/NwYRAgBHEf

Small and medium-size firms are at greater risk as they struggle to repay loans and pay workers. But there are some innovative ways governments can help them. #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/KXDk1hcrYG https://t.co/bvb1bAO2dA

New #WEO study finds that more automatic fiscal responses—such as targeted cash transfers to the poor that kick in when the unemployment rate rises above a certain level—can be highly effective in countering a downturn. #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/zjH2fQZItE https://t.co/6ZUK9NaE14
